'''Kellie Dawn Pickler''' (born June 28, 1986) is an American [[country music]] singer, actress and television personality. Pickler gained fame as a contestant on the [[American Idol (season 5)|fifth season]] of ''[[American Idol]]'' and finished in sixth place. In 2006, she signed to [[19 Entertainment|19 Recordings]] and [[BNA Records]] as a recording artist. Her debut album, ''[[Small Town Girl (album)|Small Town Girl]]'', was released later that year and has sold over 900,000 copies. The album, which was certified [[Music recording certification|gold]] by the [[Recording Industry Association of America|RIAA]], produced three singles on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] charts: "[[Red High Heels]]" at No. 15, "[[I Wonder (Kellie Pickler song)|I Wonder]]" at No. 14, and "Things That Never Cross a Man's Mind" at No. 16. 

Pickler released her [[Kellie Pickler (album)|self-titled]] second album in 2008 that produced four singles: "[[Don't You Know You're Beautiful]]" at No. 21, "[[Best Days of Your Life]]" at No. 9 (which she co-wrote with [[Taylor Swift]]), "[[Didn't You Know How Much I Loved You]]" at No. 14, and "Makin' Me Fall in Love Again" at No. 30. Following the closure of BNA Records, she moved to [[Black River Entertainment]].

On May 21, 2013, Pickler and her partner, [[Derek Hough]], won the [[Dancing with the Stars (American TV series) season 16|16th season]] of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (American TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]].'' In 2016, she was inducted into the [[North Carolina Music Hall of Fame]].

From 2017 to 2019, she co-hosted the nationally syndicated daytime TV talk show ''[[Pickler & Ben]]'' with comedian [[Ben Aaron]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cleveland.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2017/09/kellie_picklers_new_talk_show.html|title=Kellie Pickler's new talk show 'Pickler & Ben' offers a little bit of everything|last=Morona|first=Joey|date=September 18, 2017|work=[[The Plain Dealer]]|access-date=September 21, 2017}}</ref> Pickler was married to Nashville songwriter and record producer [[Kyle Jacobs (songwriter)|Kyle Jacobs]] from 2011 until his suicide in 2023.

==Early life==
[[File:Courthouse Square Park, Albemarle, North Carolina.jpg|thumb|A banner proclaims Albemarle as "Home of Kellie Pickler"|alt=A clock in a small public square with a sign proclaiming it the hometown of Kellie Pickler]]
Kellie Pickler was born June 28, 1986, at Stanly Memorial Hospital in [[Albemarle, North Carolina]], to Cynthia Morton and Clyde "Bo" Raymond Pickler Jr. Her mother left when Kellie was two years old, then returned and took custody of her for two years. Eventually, the court returned Kellie to her grandparents when she was 12 and they raised her to adulthood because her father was absent in her life.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lansinglowdown.com/index.php/article/450 |title=Country singer's runaway mom comes out of hiding :: Lowdown |publisher=Lansinglowdown.com |access-date=May 1, 2010 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100929065917/http://www.lansinglowdown.com/index.php/article/450 |archive-date=September 29, 2010 }}</ref> Pickler says the major influences in her life are her grandfather, Clyde Raymond Pickler Sr., a former [[electrician]], and grandmother, Faye Pickler.{{citation needed|date = February 2012}} Pickler graduated in 2004 from North Stanly High School in [[New London, North Carolina]] where she was a [[cheerleader]]. She sang "[[On the Side of Angels]]" by [[LeAnn Rimes]] at her high school graduation.

==''American Idol''==
The 19-year-old Pickler auditioned for ''American Idol'' in the fall of 2005 in [[Greensboro, North Carolina]]. She sang both [[Kelly Clarkson]]'s "[[Since U Been Gone]]" and [[Martina McBride]]'s "[[A Broken Wing]]". The judges sent her to Hollywood. Pickler advanced through the semi-final rounds in February. On March 9, she reached the Top 12.

Pickler was among judge [[Simon Cowell]]'s favorites. He once predicted Pickler would be in the final three, and said he preferred her over the previous season's winner, [[Carrie Underwood]].<ref>''American Idol''.[http://www.televisionwithoutpity.com/articles/content/a392/index-9.html Recap] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061026192304/http://www.televisionwithoutpity.com/articles/content/a392/index-9.html |date=October 26, 2006 }} of Season 5 Episode 12]. Retrieved March 7, 2006.</ref> Recognized for her "quirky" personality and [[Southern United States|Southern]] charm, Pickler gained attention on the show by saying that she had hardly ever performed before real audiences, and by mispronouncing words.<ref>''American Idol'' Top 24, Top 11 and Top 9</ref> She was compared to [[Jessica Simpson]] in a March 27-story in ''[[US Weekly]]'' magazine titled "Kellie: The Next Jessica Simpson", due to her "sweet Southern style and ditzy demeanor". Pickler has stated in the past a previous ignorance of common popular culture before her ''Idol'' fame.

==Post-''Idol'' career==
[[File:Kellie Pickler Dec. 16, 2008, Ramstein AFB, Germany, USO Holiday Tour.jpg|thumb|Pickler and members of her band Ryan Ochsner, left, and Joshua Henson perform for U.S. service members during the first stop of the 2008 USO Holiday Tour on [[Ramstein Air Base]], Germany, December 16, 2008|alt=Pickler singing with guitarists on either side of her]]
After her elimination, she appeared in numerous shows promoting the TV show and performed the song "[[Walkin' After Midnight]]" in some of her appearances.

On May 6, 2006, she returned to [[Albemarle, North Carolina]], for a parade and a reunion with her father. She received a key to the city from the mayor of Albemarle. The mayor also proclaimed the day as "Kellie Pickler Day". Pickler also received numerous awards from local and statewide government officials praising her accomplishments as a contestant on the ''American Idol'' television show.<ref>Hometown support links: [http://www.co.stanly.nc.us/Commissioners/Minutes/2006/05012006rm.htm Stanly County Board of Commissioners] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061002215512/http://www.co.stanly.nc.us/Commissioners/Minutes/2006/05012006rm.htm |date=October 2, 2006 }}, [http://www.albemarledowntown.com/kellie.htm Downtown Albemarle Development Corporation] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060502171805/http://www.albemarledowntown.com/kellie.htm |date=May 2, 2006 }}, [http://www.ci.albemarle.nc.us/kelliepickler.htm Official City of Albemarle Website] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060615105911/http://www.ci.albemarle.nc.us/kelliepickler.htm |date=June 15, 2006 }}</ref>

Pickler pursued her recording aspirations in [[Nashville, Tennessee]], shortly thereafter. On July 17, 2006, she signed a record deal with [[19 Entertainment|19 Recordings]]/[[BNA Records]]. She later announced it herself on ''[[The View (talk show)|The View]]''. She was part of the ''[[American Idols Live! Tour 2006|American Idols LIVE! Tour 2006]]'', performing for three months in various cities. During that period, Pickler worked on her album in collaboration with top industry experts in different cities wherever the tour took her.<ref>{{cite web|author = Rick Ellis|title = Q&A With Kellie Pickler|url = http://www.allyourtv.com/0607season/q&akelliepickler.html|publisher = allyourtv.com|date = October 30, 2006|access-date = November 22, 2006|url-status = dead|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070927182619/http://www.allyourtv.com/0607season/q%26akelliepickler.html|archive-date = September 27, 2007}}</ref>

===2006–07: ''Small Town Girl''===
Her first single, "[[Red High Heels]]", debuted on September 13, 2006, and its music video was officially released on October 26, 2006. It received a nomination for the [[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]] Video Awards for "Breakthrough Video of the Year".<ref>{{cite web |title = CMT 2007 music Awards|url = http://www.cmt.com/shows/events/cmt_music_awards/2007/vote/
|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070307151510/http://www.cmt.com/shows/events/cmt_music_awards/2007/vote/
|url-status = dead
|archive-date = March 7, 2007
|publisher = Country Music Television|date = January 31, 2007|access-date = February 2, 2007}}</ref>
Her debut album, ''[[Small Town Girl (album)|Small Town Girl]]'', released on October 31, 2006, topped Billboard's [[Top Country Albums]] and landed at number nine on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] selling over 79,000 copies in its first week, making Pickler the highest-selling first-week sales for a new artist in 2006. The album includes five songs that Pickler co-wrote with songwriters [[Chris Lindsey]], [[Aimee Mayo]], and [[Karyn Rochelle]].<ref>{{cite news|title = Kellie Pickler Debuts First Single|url = http://www.americanidol.com/news/2006/09/pickler-debuts-first-single.htm|publisher = Fox American Idol |date = September 12, 2006|access-date = September 13, 2006}}</ref><ref name="CMTinterview">{{cite news|title = CMT Loaded: CMT Top 20 Countdown 10.26.06 Kellie Pickler Interview 1|url = http://www.cmt.com/artists/az/pickler__kellie/artist.jhtml|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20061102221700/http://www.cmt.com/artists/az/pickler__kellie/artist.jhtml|url-status = dead|archive-date = November 2, 2006|publisher = Country Music Television|date = September 23, 2006|access-date = October 26, 2006}}</ref><ref>{{cite web
|title = Red High Heels – Kellie Pickler
|url = http://www.songmusiclyric.com/2006/10/22/red-high-heels-kellie-pickler/|publisher = songmusiclyric.com|date = September 22, 2006|access-date = October 28, 2006 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070301024358/http://www.songmusiclyric.com/2006/10/22/red-high-heels-kellie-pickler/ |archive-date = March 1, 2007}}</ref>

On January 18, 2007, Pickler co-hosted ''[[The View (talk show)|The View]]'' and was presented with a [[Music recording sales certification|gold record]] by [[Rosie O'Donnell]], certifying that her album has reached the 500,000 sales mark. She also performed her second single, "[[I Wonder (Kellie Pickler song)|I Wonder]]", which is a personal song about her absent relationship with her mother, Cynthia Morton. It was the first performance of the song on national television.<ref>{{cite news|title="Montana" soundtrack, Manilow lead U.S. charts |url=https://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20061108/media_nm/sales_dc_2 |publisher=[[Yahoo! News]] |date=November 8, 2006 |access-date=November 10, 2006 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title = Top recordings|url = http://www.belleville.com/mld/belleville/entertainment/15977368.htm?source=rss&channel=belleville_entertainment|publisher = [[Belleville News-Democrat]]
|date = November 10, 2006|access-date = November 10, 2006 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref>

Pickler was nominated for "Top New Female Vocalist" for the 42nd [[Academy of Country Music]] Awards.<ref>{{cite news|title = Nominations Announced for the 42ND ANNUAL ACADEMY OF COUNTRY MUSIC(R) AWARDS Country Music's Party of the Year (R)|url = http://biz.yahoo.com/prnews/070305/nym087.html
|publisher = Yahoo!|date = March 5, 2007|access-date = March 5, 2007}} {{cite web|url=http://www.sitiincontri.it |title=siti di incontri}}</ref>

She was also part of Brad Paisley's "Bonfires & Amplifiers" concert tour from April 2007 through October as one of the opening acts. The tour was booked in at least 37 cities across North America including a couple of stops in Canada.<ref>{{cite news|author = Kym Kilgore|title = Brad Paisley rolls with 'Bonfires & Amplifiers'|url = http://www.livedaily.com/news/Brad_Paisley_Taylorswift_rolls_with_Bonfires__Amplifiers-11306.html|publisher = Livedaily.com|date = January 9, 2007|access-date = January 17, 2007|url-status = dead|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070930202144/http://www.livedaily.com/news/Brad_Paisley_Taylorswift_rolls_with_Bonfires__Amplifiers-11306.html?t=98|archive-date = September 30, 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author = Mike Zeppieri|title = Calendar of Canadian concerts for June 29 to July 29'|url = https://news.yahoo.com/s/cpress/20070628/ca_pr_on_en/tab_concert_calendar_2
|publisher = Yahoo! News|date = June 28, 2007|access-date = January 1, 2007 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070705014619/http://news.yahoo.com/s/cpress/20070628/ca_pr_on_en/tab_concert_calendar_2 |archive-date = July 5, 2007}}</ref>

Pickler appeared in [[country music]] artist [[Brad Paisley]]'s music video "[[Online (Brad Paisley song)|Online]]" in 2007.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7GcVnhNjWV0 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070917102232/http://youtube.com/watch?v=7GcVnhNjWV0| archive-date=2007-09-17 | url-status=dead|title=Broadcast Yourself |via=YouTube |access-date=May 1, 2010}}</ref>

In September 2007, Pickler released a version of "[[Santa Baby]]" for a Christmas country compilation. A month later, at the [[American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers|ASCAP]] Awards in [[Nashville, Tennessee]], Pickler received a songwriter award for co-writing "Red High Heels". She performed "I Wonder", at the 2007 [[CMA Awards]]. During the performance, she was visibly overcome with emotion and struggled to even finish the song before bursting into tears. The performance received a [[standing ovation]]. She was also nominated for the Horizon Award. The performance led her to receive 3 [[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]] awards the following April.

===2008–10: ''Kellie Pickler''===
While "[[Things That Never Cross a Man's Mind]]" was climbing the country charts (it eventually reached number sixteen), Pickler returned to the studio to record her second studio album for [[19 Entertainment|19 Recordings]]/[[BNA Records]]. She performed the debut single, "[[Don't You Know You're Beautiful]]" at the [[Academy of Country Music|ACM Awards]] on May 18, 2008, and received a good response from the audience. She was nominated for "Top New Female Vocalist", but the award went to [[Taylor Swift]].

"Don't You Know You're Beautiful" was released to radio in June 2008 and was a Top 25 hit for Pickler, peaking eventually at number twenty-one. Her second album, ''[[Kellie Pickler (album)|Kellie Pickler]]'', was released on September 30, 2008, and debuted at the top of the country chart, as well as number nine on the ''Billboard'' 200, selling over 43,000 copies in its first week. It matched the debuting spots of her first album, ''[[Small Town Girl (album)|Small Town Girl]]''.

On November 12, 2008, Pickler performed the second single from her album ''[[Best Days of Your Life]]'' at the [[CMA Awards]]. She was also nominated for "New Artist of the Year" for the second year in a row, but lost to [[Lady Antebellum]]. "Best Days of Your Life" made its radio debut in November 2008, and debuted at number 56. The song climbed very slowly up the chart, but ended up becoming Pickler's first Top 10 hit on the [[Hot Country Songs]] chart. After nearly 40 weeks on the chart, the song peaked at number nine in August 2009. A music video was made by [[Roman White]], featuring [[Taylor Swift]], who co-wrote and sang background harmony vocals on the song.

Pickler was nominated for "Female Video of the Year" at the 2009 [[CMT Music Awards]] for "Don't You Know You're Beautiful". She lost once again to Swift. She also presented the award for "USA Weekend Breakthrough Video of the Year" with ''Idol'' judge [[Randy Jackson]].

Pickler accompanied Swift on the first leg of her [[Fearless Tour]] 2009. In June, she launched her first ever headline concert tour in promotion of her self-titled album. On October 8, it was announced that Pickler would be part of the second leg of ''Fearless Tour''.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/267140/taylor-swift-announces-second-leg-of-fearless-tour |title=Taylor Swift announces second leg of Fearless Tour |magazine=Billboard |date=September 14, 2009 |access-date=July 29, 2012}}</ref>

"[[Didn't You Know How Much I Loved You]]", a re-recording from Pickler's first album ''[[Small Town Girl (album)|Small Town Girl]]'', was released as the album's third single on August 30, 2009. The song debuted at number 55 on the U.S. ''Billboard'' Hot Country Songs chart, and became her fifth Top 20 hit, peaking at number fourteen in February 2010.

On October 26, Pickler won the title of Country Weekly's poll of most beautiful woman in country music for the second year in a row. [[Reba McEntire]] and [[Carrie Underwood]] were the second and third places, respectively.<ref>[http://www.cmt.ca/News/NewsItem.aspx?news_id=8675] {{dead link|date=June 2024}}</ref>

"Makin' Me Fall in Love Again" was released as the album's fourth single on April 19, 2010. It debuted at number 53 and peaked at number 30.

===2011–12: ''100 Proof''===
It was announced that Pickler's third album would be produced by Frank Liddell, known for producing country artist [[Miranda Lambert]]'s [[Miranda Lambert discography|albums]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Hazel Smith |url=http://www.cmt.com/news/hot-dish/1627685/hot-dish-its-been-a-great-year-for-country-music.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100526101431/http://www.cmt.com/news/hot-dish/1627685/hot-dish-its-been-a-great-year-for-country-music.jhtml |url-status=dead |archive-date=May 26, 2010 |title=Cmt News |publisher=Country Music Television |date=December 7, 2009 |access-date=July 29, 2012}}</ref> "[[Tough (Kellie Pickler song)|Tough]]" was released on June 13, 2011, as the lead-off single to Pickler's third album, ''[[100 Proof (album)|100 Proof]]'', which was released on January 24, 2012. The album debuted at number seven on the ''Billboard'' 200 and at number two on the Top Country Albums chart. "Tough" reached a peak of number 30 on the Hot Country Songs chart, while the album's [[100 Proof (song)|title track]], which was released as the second single in April 2012, peaked at number 50 on the same chart.

On June 27, 2012, ABC News Radio reported that Pickler parted ways with [[Sony Music Nashville|Sony Nashville]]. Pickler's manager told ABC News Radio, "Kellie's contract with Sony came to an end and they mutually decided not to renew it".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2012/6/27/kellie-picklers-camp-confirms-split-with-sony-music-nashvill.html |title=Kellie Pickler's Camp Confirms Split with Sony Music Nashville – Music News – ABC News Radio |publisher=Abcnewsradioonline.com |date=June 27, 2012 |access-date=July 29, 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120725130935/http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2012/6/27/kellie-picklers-camp-confirms-split-with-sony-music-nashvill.html#ixzz1z2A0NESc |archive-date=July 25, 2012 }}</ref>
On July 10, 2012, she sang "[[God Bless America]]" during the seventh inning stretch at the [[2012 Major League Baseball All-Star Game]].
On October 8, 2012, [[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]] reported Pickler had signed with the independent record label [[Black River Entertainment]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Kellie Pickler Signs to Black River Entertainment|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/news-in-brief/1695102/kellie-pickler-signs-to-black-river-entertainment.jhtml|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121011012319/http://www.cmt.com/news/news-in-brief/1695102/kellie-pickler-signs-to-black-river-entertainment.jhtml|url-status=dead|archive-date=October 11, 2012|publisher=CMT|access-date=October 8, 2012}}</ref>

===2013–present: ''The Woman I Am''===
Pickler's first single with Black River Entertainment, "[[Someone Somewhere Tonight]]," was released on May 14, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/someone-somewhere-tonight/id643082388?i=643082517 |title=iTunes Music – Someone Somewhere Tonight – Single by Kellie Pickler |publisher=iTunes Store |date=May 14, 2013 |access-date=June 1, 2013}}</ref> After eight weeks, it reached a peak of number 49 on the ''Billboard'' Country Airplay chart in July 2013, and served as the lead-off single to Pickler's fourth album, ''[[The Woman I Am (Kellie Pickler album)|The Woman I Am]]'', which was released on November 11, 2013. Pickler wrote the title track with her husband, songwriter Kyle Jacobs.<ref name="Pickler Branches Out on New Album">{{cite magazine|last=Gold|first=Adam|title=Kellie Pickler Branches Out on New Album 'The Woman I Am'|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/kellie-pickler-branches-out-on-new-album-the-woman-i-am-20130913|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=September 13, 2013 |access-date=September 13, 2013}}</ref>

"[[Little Bit Gypsy]]" and "Closer to Nowhere" were released as the album's second and third singles and reached peaks of number 50 and number 59 on the Country Airplay chart, respectively. A promotional single, "Feeling Tonight," was made available as a digital download on June 2, 2015, but never received an official radio release. It was later announced in June 2016, that Pickler had parted ways with Black River.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/kellie-pickler-black-river-entertainment-split/|title=Kellie Pickler Parts Ways With Black River Entertainment|first=Sterling|last=Whitaker|website=Tasteofcountry.com|date=June 18, 2016 }}</ref>

On May 21, 2013, Pickler and [[Derek Hough]] were announced the winners of the [[Dancing with the Stars (American season 16)|sixteenth season]] of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (American TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]''. She performed a well received super sized freestyle, which scored a perfect 30 and garnered effusive praise from the dance judges.<ref>{{cite web|title=Dorothy Hamill and Andy Dick among 'Dancing' stars|url=http://www.nypost.com/p/entertainment/tv/dorothy_hamill_and_andy_dick_among_art7dOspaAd3bBHI5z2ekN|work=New York Post|date=February 26, 2013 |access-date=February 26, 2013}}</ref> She performed "Little Bit Gypsy" on November 25, 2013, episode in the [[Dancing with the Stars (American season 17)|seventeenth season]].

In 2013, Pickler starred as Mirabelle in the fiftieth [[VeggieTales]] video, ''Beauty and the Beet'' released on October 14, 2014.{{Citation needed|date=May 2023}} In February 2022, Pickler began work as a DJ on [[SiriusXM]]'s country music station, ''The Highway.''<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.siriusxm.com/hosts/kellie-pickler#:~:text=Kellie%20Pickler%20on%20The%20Highway&text=56)%20Monday%20through%20Friday%20from,on%20the%20SXM%20App%20now | title=Platinum-selling country singer/Songwriter and actress, Kellie Pickler, is now a host on the Highway on SiriusXM! }}</ref>

==Personal life==
Pickler's parents split up the day after her second birthday; a year later, in July 1989, her mother vanished. During periods when her father, Bo, was incarcerated, she would live with her grandparents outside Albemarle, {{convert|45|mi}} northeast of [[Charlotte, North Carolina|Charlotte]]. In 1992, Pickler's mother returned to Albemarle, but rarely made contact with her. But in March 1995, with Bo Pickler in prison for armed robbery, her mother was granted custody. Pickler was in the fourth grade. In a February 2006 interview with the ''[[Charlotte Observer]]'', Pickler said: "She got custody of me for two years... During that time, she was physically and mentally abusive of me." In a 1997 court filing, Pickler's grandparents said that her mother had moved to [[Union County, North Carolina|Union County]] with her and treated her harshly. The court restored custody to the grandparents. Her mother vanished again. Her father, whom she describes as an alcoholic and [[drug addict]], served a three-year-nine-month prison sentence at [[Florida State Prison]] for [[aggravated assault]] and [[battery (crime)|battery]] stemming from a 2003 stabbing incident.<ref>[http://www.charlotte.com/mld/charlotte/entertainment/television/13893587.htm 'American Idol's' Pickler: Singer and survivor], [[Charlotte Observer]], February 17, 2006. Retrieved July 5, 2006.</ref> <!-- dead reference :: [http://www.dc.state.fl.us/activeinmates/detail.asp?Bookmark=1&From=list&SessionID=431956515] --> He was released on May 6, 2006, a week after her elimination from ''Idol''. In an April 2006 interview with [[National Broadcasting Company|NBC]] Pickler said, "One thing that's so important in life is we learn to forgive others. I ask the Lord every day to forgive me for my sins and for things that I've done wrong. And who am I to not forgive someone for what they've done?" ..."God tells us to love everyone."<ref>[http://www.wcnc.com/news/topstories/stories/wcnc-042806-kellie.7c42b036.html] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070305230245/http://www.wcnc.com/news/topstories/stories/wcnc-042806-kellie.7c42b036.html|date=March 5, 2007}}</ref>

In 2007, Pickler was in a relationship with [[Nashville Predators]] player [[Jordin Tootoo]] and visited his family in [[Nunavut]].<ref>{{cite news |title = Kellie Pickler's New Love |url = http://www.usmagazine.com/kellie_pickler_love |work=US Magazine |date=May 23, 2007 |access-date=June 27, 2007 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070525044028/http://usmagazine.com/kellie_pickler_love |archive-date = May 25, 2007}}</ref><ref name=Nunavut>[https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/north/nunavut-hockey-star-introduces-american-idol-girlfriend-to-family-1.688351?ref=rss Nunavut hockey star introduces American Idol girlfriend to family]. CBC News. June 21, 2007.</ref> Later that year, the two broke up.<ref>Aarthun, Sarah. [http://www.wcnc.com/kelliepickler/stories/wcnc-100207-jmn-pickler_hockey-pickler_section.12ea85b87.html Kellie Pickler breaks it off with 'hockey guy'] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.today/20070617001912/http://www.wcnc.com/kelliepickler/stories/wcnc-100207-jmn-pickler_hockey-pickler_section.12ea85b87.html |date=June 17, 2007 }}. ''The Charlotte Observer''. WCNC-TV. October 2, 2007.</ref>

[[File:25 Dec. 2016 CJCS USO Holiday Tour PT. 2 161225-D-PB383-061 (31061990464).jpg|200px|thumb|left|Pickler was married to songwriter [[Kyle Jacobs (songwriter)|Kyle Jacobs]] from 2011 until his suicide in 2023.]]

After two and a half years of dating, Pickler became engaged to songwriter [[Kyle Jacobs (songwriter)|Kyle Jacobs]] on June 15, 2010.<ref>{{cite news |last=Derschowitz |first=Jessica |title=Kyle Jacobs and Kellie Picker are Engaged |newspaper= CBS News N.p. |date=June 23, 2010 |access-date= June 23, 2010 |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/kyle-jacobs-and-kellie-picker-are-engaged/}}</ref> For a background piece on ''Dancing with the Stars'', Pickler related that the couple had planned an elaborate ceremony, but as the date approached, "I looked at him and said, 'Baby, this ain't us.'"<ref name="MostMemorableYear">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oEDrWWHLplA YouTube video of Kellie Pickler segment] of "Most Memorable Year" episode of ''Dancing with the Stars'' Season 16, aired April 8, 2013.</ref> On January 1, 2011, she and Jacobs eloped and married in a "small, intimate ceremony on a private island in the Caribbean".<ref>{{cite web |title=Kellie Pickler & Kyle Jacobs Have a Surprise Wedding |work= People |date=January 4, 2011 |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20454272,00.html }}</ref>

In 2015, it was announced that Pickler and Jacobs would star in a 13-episode reality show for CMT entitled ''I Love Kellie Pickler''. The show premiered on November 5, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|title=Kellie Pickler gets personal, but no drama on reality show|url=http://www.charlotteobserver.com/entertainment/article42197973.html|website=The Charlotte Observer|access-date=November 3, 2015}}{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>

On February 17, 2023, Jacobs died by a self-inflicted gunshot wound in [[Nashville, Tennessee]] at the age of 49.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Hume |first=Ashley |date=2023-02-17 |title=Kellie Pickler's husband Kyle Jacobs dead at 49 after apparent suicide: police |url=https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/kellie-picklers-husband-kyle-jacobs-dead-apparent-suicide-police |access-date=2023-02-18 |website=Foxnews.com |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Shafer |first=Ellise |date=2023-02-18 |title=Kellie Pickler's Husband Kyle Jacobs Identified as Man Found Dead at Singer's House |url=https://variety.com/2023/music/news/kellie-pickler-house-man-dead-suicide-1235527221/ |access-date=2023-02-18 |website=Variety.com |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Kellie Pickler's Husband Kyle Jacobs Identified as Man Found Dead at Singer's House |url=https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/kellie-pickler-husband-kyle-jacobs-002751515.html |access-date=2023-02-18 |website=Yahoo.com |date=February 18, 2023 |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Kellie Pickler's husband Kyle Jacobs dead by suicide in Nashville home |url=https://www.nydailynews.com/snyde/ny-kellie-pickler-husband-kyle-jacobs-dead-suicide-20230218-ejwptk475bbkhg5yghkwnx7oxy-story.html |access-date=2023-02-18 |website=New York Daily News|date=February 17, 2023 }}</ref>
<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://people.com/kellie-pickler-breaks-silence-thanks-fans-after-husband-kyle-jacobs-death-suicide-exclusive-7644767|title=Kellie Pickler Breaks Silence, Thanks Fans After Husband Kyle Jacobs' Death: 'Darkest Time in My Life' (Exclusive)|website=People.com}}</ref>

===Philanthropy===
[[File:Kellie Pickler 2008-11-06 (2).jpg|thumb|left|upright|Pickler in [[Jacksonville, Florida]], November 6, 2008|alt=Pickler singing while holding a microphone]]
Pickler actively supports [[St. Jude Children's Research Hospital]], where she helps raise funds and gives kids special visits. She also participates in charitable events to help raise funds for various organizations. She has performed to help raise funds for the "N.C. Children's PROMISE" to benefit the Children's Hospital on November 12, 2006,<ref>{{cite web|title = RADIOTHON/TELETHON|url = http://ncchildrenspromise.org/radiothon.shtml|publisher = ncchildrenspromise.org|date = November 16, 2006|access-date = March 7, 2007|url-status = dead|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070705080952/http://www.ncchildrenspromise.org/radiothon.shtml|archive-date = July 5, 2007}}</ref> to help refurbish the [[Hurricane Katrina]]-damaged NFL Youth Education Towns Boys & Girls Club of [[New Orleans]] on December 16, 2006,<ref>{{cite web|title = CMT, Cox Restock N.O. Kids' Haven|url = http://www.multichannel.com/article/CA6397326.html?display=Breaking+News|publisher = MultiChannel.com|date = December 5, 2006|access-date = March 7, 2007}}</ref> visited St. Jude Children's Research Hospital on January 12, 2007,<ref>{{cite web|title = St. Jude|url = http://kelliepickler.com/site.php?content=links|publisher = kelliepickler.com|date = March 1, 2007 |access-date = March 7, 2007 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070819111710/http://www.kelliepickler.com/site.php?content=links |archive-date = August 19, 2007}}</ref> and visited Pennington Elementary School on February 1, 2007.<ref>{{cite web|title = Kellie Pickler Adjusts to Spotlight|url = http://www.gactv.com/gac/nw_headlines/article/0,,GAC_26063_5324115,00.html|archive-url = https://archive.today/20130123151657/http://www.gactv.com/gac/nw_headlines/article/0,,GAC_26063_5324115,00.html|url-status = dead|archive-date = January 23, 2013|publisher = gactv.com|date = February 2, 2007|access-date = March 7, 2007}}</ref> "When you're able to give back to your communities and organizations like St. Jude, it's a great thing," Pickler said. "It's been a great experience, and I encourage anyone and everyone to help."<ref>{{cite web |title = Country stars visit St. Jude |url = http://www.stjude.org/countrycares/0,2710,618_3348_22427,00.html?rss=fundraising|publisher = stjude.org |date = January 12, 2007|access-date = March 7, 2007}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref>

Pickler participated with other country artists in an online auction for charity by Mario Magro: Kiss for a Cause Foundation Celebrity Auction held June 15–25, 2007, in support of orphaned and abandoned children. The event auctioned off celebrity lip prints and signatures pressed on the inside of Mario Magro Crystal Le Coop handbags at the 42nd Annual Academy of Country Music Awards.<ref>{{cite web|title = Mario magro kiss for a cause foundation to hold online celebrity auction|url = http://www.kissforacause.org/press.html|publisher = Kissforacause.org|date = June 10, 2007|access-date = June 28, 2007|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070809064926/http://www.kissforacause.org/press.html|archive-date = August 9, 2007|url-status = dead}}</ref> In November 2007, Pickler appeared on a celebrity edition of the [[quiz show]] ''[[Are You Smarter than a 5th Grader? (American game show)|Are You Smarter Than a 5th Grader?]]'', playing for the charities of her choice, [[American Red Cross]] and the [[AARP]]'s Grandparenting Program.<ref>{{cite news|title = Kellie Appears on "Are You Smarter Than A 5th Grader|url = http://www.kelliepickler.com/site.php?em2277=185249_-1__0_~0_-1_9_2008_0_0|publisher = KelliePickler.com|date = November 12, 2007|access-date = September 11, 2008}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cey35bBWXls| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111024175651/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cey35bBWXls&gl=US&hl=en| archive-date=2011-10-24 | url-status=dead|title=YouTube|via=YouTube}}</ref> During the show, she was asked to name the European country for which Budapest is the capital, to which she responded "...I thought Europe ''was'' a country ...I know they speak French there. Is France a country?"  She chose the copy cheat, allowing her to go along with the 3rd grader's correct response of Hungary.<ref>{{cite news|title = Dumbest Blonde Ever
|url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r8pnec4Hxps|via = YouTube|date = December 7, 2007|access-date = August 29, 2014}}</ref>

Pickler has participated in three tours on behalf of [[United Service Organizations]]. The first, in late 2007 and early 2008, took her to Iraq;<ref name="GACMyUSODiary">{{cite video| people = Kellie Pickler| title = Kellie Pickler: My USO Diary| url = http://www.gactv.com/gac/ar_az_kellie_pickler| medium = TV-Documentary Special| publisher = GACTV| location = Iraq|year = 2008| url-status = dead| archive-url = https://archive.today/20130123143310/http://www.gactv.com/gac/ar_az_kellie_pickler| archive-date = January 23, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title = Kellie Pickler to Perform on USO Tour|url = http://www.americanidol.com/news/view/?pid=1105|publisher = Dave|date = December 3, 2007|access-date = December 3, 2007}}</ref> the second, in December 2008, included stops in Germany, Afghanistan, Iraq, Kosovo, and England.<ref>[http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20248545,00.html Kellie Pickler's USO Tour] ''People'', December 22, 2008</ref> In January 2010, Pickler made stops in Iraq and Kuwait on a 10-day tour with Randy Houser and Jamey Johnson. The three country stars "played remote bases on the front lines of the war zone, and the sound of gun fire became their frequent companion at night."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.gactv.com/blog/2010/02/04/randy-houser-puts-his-army-boots-on/ |title=Randy Houser puts his army boots on |publisher=Blog.gactv.com |date=February 4, 2010 |access-date=February 14, 2010 |archive-date=February 6, 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100206070733/http://blog.gactv.com/blog/2010/02/04/randy-houser-puts-his-army-boots-on/ |url-status=dead }}</ref>

In early August 2009, Pickler participated in ABC's ''[[Extreme Makeover: Home Edition]]'''s rebuilding of James Terpenning's family home in [[Beavercreek, Ohio]]. Pickler performed a free concert at the home, and helped during reconstruction.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://projects.daytondailynews.com/cache/galleries/Entertainment/Music/2009extrememakeover_pickler/ |title=Dayton Daily News | Kellie Pickler performs at 'Makeover' site |publisher=Projects.daytondailynews.com |date=August 5, 2009 |access-date=May 1, 2010 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091209172102/http://projects.daytondailynews.com/cache/galleries/Entertainment/Music/2009extrememakeover_pickler/ |archive-date=December 9, 2009 }}</ref>

On June 26, 2016, on an episode of ''[[Celebrity Family Feud]]'', Pickler and her team won $25,000 for her charity, [[USO]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Brelsford |first1=Erin |title=Kellie Pickler Nearly Took a Tumble on "Family Feud" |url=https://www.onecountry.com/country-music/kellie-pickler-family-feud/ |website=Onecountry.com |date=June 27, 2016 |access-date=January 17, 2020 |archive-date=November 29, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201129021218/https://www.onecountry.com/country-music/kellie-pickler-family-feud/ |url-status=dead }}</ref>

{{Clear}}
